Title: Summary comparison - correctness policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary includes less false information.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly better than B (Score: -2)
A slightly better than B (Score: -1)
Neither A or B is better than the other (Score: 0)
B slightly better than A (Score: 1)
B significantly better than B (Score 2)
column2:
Title: Summary comparison - accuracy policy

Objective
Evaluate which summary provides a more accurate representation of the reference text.

Instructions
You are given 2 summaries (A, B) created from a reference text. Evaluate which summary provides a more accurate representation of the reference text.

Scoring Criteria
A significantly more accurate than B (Score: -2)
A slightly more accurate than B (Score: -1)
Both summaries are equally accurate (Score: 0)
B slightly more accurate than A (Score: 1)
B significantly more accurate than A (Score: 2)

Rationale
Accuracy is determined by the completeness and precision of the information presented in the summaries compared to the reference text. Consider the inclusion of uncertain or speculative language, as well as the level of detail and accuracy in describing the findings.
